intro: Antiostelma manipurense, commonly known as the Manipur antiostelma, is a rare flowering plant native to the northeastern region of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
